Topic: "Irrationality of Square Roots of Natural Numbers"

 Abstract:
 			My presentation summarizes work that I did for my senior seminar presentation under Dr. Walz. This presentation will show how I went about proving that the square root of all natural numbers, except perfect squares, are irrational. I would like to give thanks to Dr. Mcloughlin, Dr. Landquist, and Dr. Walz for their help in this presentation.

Topic: "My Favorit Integer Sequences, or, Confessions of a Sequence Addict"

 Abstract:
 			The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences (or OEIS, oeis.org) is a free web site that contains information about a quarter of a million sequences, and is often called one of the most useful mathematical sites on the Web. I will discuss some of my favorites, including the van Eck, Zizka, Fredkin, Quet, Kelly, Yellowstone, etc. sequences. There will be music, movies, and a number of unsolved problems. Warning: some of these may prevent you sleeping at night.

string-array.name: facultyPresentations
string-array.item: Chirstopher Michael Amici (Kutztown University of Pennsylvania)

resources.string:
Topic: "How to Engage and INspire Students through Student-Led Learning"

 Abstract:
 			An impressive collection of research suggests that student-led learning (ï¬‚ipped learning or IBL) improves the acquisition of student outcomes. Still, case studies demonstrate that certain instructors have an easier time than others establishing class expectations that best facilitate student learning. In this talk, I will include research from a variety of disciplines that has helped me improve the culture in my classes. I will also make the case that it is worthwhile to incorporate student-led learning, even if only in small ways, into all courses.
